items.title: It's harder to get home insurance. That's changing communities across the U.S.
bullets: • The cost of home insurance rose about 8% faster than overall inflation between 2018 and 2022, a Treasury Department report says
• Climate change is likely to drive more severe hurricanes, floods and wildfires, experts say
• Insurance costs are also rising because people are moving to coastal regions vulnerable to hurricanes and forested areas
